item.title: By: SQLDenis

item.description: Ian, looks interesting and should also remind all of us how lucky we are and we shouldn't complain next time we have to clean up 6 inches of snow...there are people far worse off and they are accomplish more with way less<br /> <br />
item.content:encoded: Ian, looks interesting and should also remind all of us how lucky we are and we shouldn’t complain next time we have to clean up 6 inches of snow…there are people far worse off and they are accomplish more with way less

item.title: By: Ian Stirk
item.dc:creator: Ian Stirk
item.content:encoded:
Hi Denis,

thank you for recommending my book (SQL Server DMVs in action), hopefully it will be available shortly.

Might I suggest a non-technical book that you and others might find interesting…. It’s called “Blind Jack of Knaresborough”, here’s my amazon.co.uk review:

This is a great read, irrespective of the type of book you usually read.

Jack was made blind at the age of 6, but he subsequently had careers as a guide, musician, soldier, trader, and most famously of all, a road builder. Additionally he has an `interesting’ personal life (e.g. got a woman pregnant while having another girlfriend, eloping with his true love, playing and winning at cards, brawling, and living to 92 years old)

This book is full of adventure, and inspiration. The author has done a first class job in making the life of Blind Jack available to a wider audience.

Thanks again
Ian
